Reviews.Title: “OK as a stopover”
Reviews.Author: B0zee
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here for 2 nights on the way to Australia but it was clean, comfortable and reasonable. Internet was free in the lobby or the Breeze lounge. A nominal charge if you wanted it available in the room. I note Caustic's comments but my room was fine. I wouldn't say it was a wonderful location but it was within easy walking distance of the Ferries etc. My experience matches that of Mabul so there's no point in me duplicating his review.

Reviews.Title: “Good value decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mabul
Reviews.Content: The Central Park Hotel: Room: Yes the rooms are small, but this is Hong Kong, small rooms are the norm. The room I had was clean and modern, and was more than enough for my needs. The room also had decent view over a small park. Had satellite TV with plenty of English channels, also channels showing Premiership football if that’s your cup of tea. Food: I did not eat in the hotel so cannot comment. Location: The Hotel is centrally located (hence the name) and is a short walk from shops and restaurants. It is a short cab ride to the busier districts of Wan Chi and Lan Kwai Fong. Cabs are so cheap and plentiful this is not an issue. There is a nice bar just over the road from the hotel, although it is expensive. Staff: I found the staff to be helpful and courteous throughout my stay, no complaints what so ever. They dealt with check in and check out quickly and efficiently. Overall: I had a good stay at this hotel, and genuinely cannot understand the really negative reviews it has received. It is a good hotel in a good location that represents excellent value for money. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible wouldn't recommend at all cheats and they steal.”
Reviews.Author: Marijaniceee
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't recommend the hotel at all. Lost my iPod in breakfast room went back to get it and they said I didn't leave it there then went and asked cleaner same reply didn't leave it in the room. Not with me for sure so someone is lying about it and stole my iPod.also they promised us free wifi did not get it.if they say free wifi it isn't it's just a way to entchance people.rooms very small no place for baggage and smells damp.found dirty sheets left under bed.view isn't very good either.and the rooms are noisy.people on front desk are not cooperative and do not help at all. Also the phones don't work. All in all I didn't enjoy any part of my stay in the hotel and had to shorten my stay there from.5 nights to 1 night. Not comfortable at all.would leave this hotel till the last one on the list only go here incase of emergency.they are overly priced for what the hotel is.DO NOT pay for breakfast it isn't good and only have one table of choice. Hotel was terrible and wouldn't care if it closed down.

Reviews.Title: “A shabby, filthy hole. A hovel that should be shut down.”
Reviews.Author: Caustic C
Reviews.Content: Rising damp, whole walls covered with mould, ill fitting windows, stained carpets, dents, scratches and beds so short a pygmy would have problems. These are probably the worst of the issues at this hotel. Plus there is no way on Earth that Sheung Wan can be described as the "financial and commericial hear of Hong Kong." Read more: http://www.causticcandy.com/2012/05/central_park_hotel/

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: MattyMattyMatty
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for a week during a holiday in Hong Kong. We had the basic small room, which I feared would be too small. Turned out it was absolutely fine given the amount of time one spends in a hotel room on a holiday. My only gripe with the room is that the toilet and shower were in a frosted glass box round the corner from the bed. Not the best for toilet privacy! The room was clean and had a bowl of fresh fruit, bathrobes, lots of toiletries etc. TV had plenty of channels for our jetlagged nights. There were only two lifts and only one works at night. This was a little bit annoying, but not the end of the world. It was well located for us. Close to a McDonalds, a 7-11, a couple of cute little bakeries and an international supermarket. Also close to Kau Kee (which I seriously recommend), a nice little temple which seemed to attract a fair few tourists and a really nice little park with pagodas and a stream with turtles and fish. Away from the hustle and bustle, but only ten minutes walk to the centre with all the malls etc. I really enjoyed my stay here. Was perfect for just sleeping and evening chilling out. Would definitely stay again. No idea how much it cost, but it must have been good value for my partner to have booked it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Someplaceelse_12
Reviews.Content: Although located at Sheung Wan, it was very accessible, by walking, to restaurants, MTR Station, Soho area and bar area Lan Kwai Fong. Room size was small in HK Standard, if you stay for short stay, it was fine. Check in was easy, staff were polite, overall was good.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Markylush
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights during the Hong Kong Sevens, which will explain the high prices! Comfortable and basic rooms although VERY small and compact - exactly what you would expect in Hong Kong. Located in the Sheung Wan district reasonably close to Central, and in mid-levels about 1 kilometre walk from Lan Kwai Fong entertainment district. The location OK but still a good walk to the nearest MTR station (Sheung Wan). WIFI service is good and charged daily at $120HK maximum per day. No dining services at all. Rooms were cleaned daily and overall was an OK, but not spectacular place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Hong Kong and stayed for a few nights at the Central Park Hotel. If you want to hear the next room residents talk to each other or have your room walls vibrate when they have a shower this is the hotel for you. Double bed had a wooden spar down the middle of it. Small room and ''compact'' shower/toilet. Worst I have ever been in.......:-(

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms but ok”
Reviews.Author: Franck Y
Reviews.Content: The room are really tiny, the price was somewhat decent ! The location is pretty good but don t expect to spend a lot of time in you room

Reviews.Title: “Location good, quality poor.”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: From reviews I expected the room to be tiny. It was. But what I found highly objectionable was that the rugs and walls were worn and dirty and the shower corners were moldy. Worst for me was that the room smelled over poweringly musty. Have they done any upkeep to this place at all?

Reviews.Title: “A tiny value-for-money gem”
Reviews.Author: asoloist
Reviews.Content: First off, it is absolutely true that the rooms are TINY at this hotel. But again if you're here to revel in a hotel room, you shouldn't be in Hong Kong. The service is excellent and friendly, rivalling that of the four or five-star business or luxury hotels in the territory. The staff is extremely knowledgeable--eg, the best local joint for Chinese breakfast (a hole in the wall specializing in congee about five minutes away). They were efficient and unflappable even during the morning rush hour of check-out. The location is very good. It's not quite as centrally located as everyone would have you believe, meaning it's still about a ten minute walk to the Sheung Wan MTR station, which is the nearest subway. But it's about a five minute walk from the nearest tram line. And having lived in many big cities, I can attest that it is very well positioned for taxis. Even in the rain, it wasn't difficult spotting an empty cab. But Hollywood Road is just a minute's walk away, and the steady Western gentrification has spread farther west. Which means there is an excellent range of cosy restaurants and bars all along the strip. If you walk east, you eventually hit the antiques shop and gallery nub as well as Lan Kwai Fong (an expat haven for decades). I stayed in a standard room on one of the executive floors (high up in the building), which was very small. The closet could hold about three suits, but it did come with two fluffy white bathrobes and slippers. (A very nice touch that should be a worldwide hotel standard, not just in East Asia.) The space is efficiently used, ie, the sink was in the main room, sharing the same counter that also functions as a "desk." The bathroom was just the commode and a standing shower---all much nicer than described as thus. It comes pretty well-stocked with shampoo, soap, razor, toothbrush/toothpaste, hairbrush, etc. Everything was immaculately clean. There's a flat-screen TV with some satellite/cable stations like CNN, BBC, ESPN, etc, and the local HK stations (Cantonese and English language). The room temperature was perhaps a touch cool as there is no heater. (Just a/c for the summer months.) Be warned, with HK's humidity, the room can get a little moist without the a/c on---even in the winter. There's Wi-Fi and a LAN connection for Internet, but there is a daily rate. Wi-Fi is free in the lobby. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel, but there does appear to be that option somewhere. There is no gym or business centre. There is a free shuttle bus that runs from Central Park Hotel to its two other sister hotels in Central and also the Hong Kong station of the Airport Express train in the IFC, which is a super-swank shopping mall with a cinema, hotels, restaurants, bars, and one of the best western-comfort food supermarkets in Asia. From the IFC you easily can hit the ferries and get around the Central business district. All this for a great price, a couple of hundred US dollars below the going rate at hotels with similar quality service (although admittedly bigger rooms and more amenities).

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: IreneBlag
Reviews.Content: Central Park Hotel is a lovely boutique hotel in Hong Kong. Located in Hollywood Road, it has numerous antique stores and pleasant places to have breakfast at nearby. The room was rather small, yet nicely decorated in green and white. Bed linen was changed after 2 nights together with robes and slippers. The usual amenity set contains quality body milk of light, easily absorbed texture. The reception deserves praising (helpful and speaking comprehensible English), as well as the lobby design. So, I’d recommend Central Park for a short stay in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, useful for seeing HK”
Reviews.Author: DaveNL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small&tall, has a staircase to get to the elevator and the rooms are very compact. We did not have breakfast at the hotel. This being said: it is a reasonably priced hotel not far from the highlights of HK Island. The Man Mo Temple is a few blocks east, Queens road is 1 block north, the pier is 10-15 minutes walking, the peak tram 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the rest of the room?”
Reviews.Author: shootthepainoplayer
Reviews.Content: compact doesnt quite cover it, the rooms are tiny (and i was staying on the executive floor!). I'm 5'8 and my feet hung off the end of the bed. they've clearly saved money on common walls between rooms, i could hear the guy in the room next to me coughing all the time. there is virtually no space for your luggage, even finding enough floor space to open up my suitcase was a problem. the wardrobe is a joke, with shelves that are 4 inched deep! The bathroom isnt properly ventilated, even with the sliding door closed when taking a shower the entire room steams up right up to the windows. the internet which they make you pay for is unbearably slow - i couldnt even load skype. and lastly avoid the room service! i got in off a flight tired and just wanting to eat something quick before bed, and what arrived was the most inedible attempt at spaghetti i've ever seen! the location is simply not worth it! stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss lodging”
Reviews.Author: Soniab13
Reviews.Content: A co-worker booked the hotel for me and we had asked for an "average business class" hotel - which is pretty much what we got. My room was fine - it was small but the bed area was essentially "within" a picture window, so it had some charm. My traveling companion was less fortunate - her room had mold on the floor/carpet (with an overwhelming smell) and only a tiny window. She changed to another room and it was "okay" but still not as nice as mine. We were on "executive" floors so I'd hate to see what the other rooms were like. It was clear that they weren't situated for business travelers - it was more of a tourist hotel. Hauling luggage up and down a half-dozen steps (with no offer of help) was a downer, and we had to argue with them to get us a car service for our trip to the airport. The elevators were very slow too. Pluses: Complementary fruit delivered to the room on the first night was nice, and bottled water. Good wi-fi, decent price all-around given the rates in HK. They also had a power adapter in the room - a rare, unexpected treat! Negatives: Location wasn't very central to Central, breakfast was barely worth attempting, no hotel should ever allow people to stay in rooms with mold - ever. Reception area was very tiny and usually crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Sarah T
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. Paid extra for city views but were originally given a room without a window! Second room shower was covered in mould and made the whole room smell terrible. Finally were given a clean but noisy room. Staff were unhelpful and not at all apologetic. Overly priced for such small rooms but good location for nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small”
Reviews.Author: LuceTravel1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really clean and the decor is nice. The bathroom is not at all private, only separated from the room by fairly transparent frosted glass. When you enter the room you walk through the bathroom first. The staff are really helpful and professional. At the time we were there the temp was around 30 degrees and the humidity was extreme this wouldn't have bothered except that our air conditioner barely worked, there was no way to even open a window to get some fresh air in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service but small and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Fleur G
Reviews.Content: Service was great! The look of the hotel is chic and nice and clean. But the rooms are incredibly small and can get a little noisy in the evening when neighbours turn out taps and stuff. Good value though!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, small rooms (but this is Hong Kong!!!), would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Fikoukla
Reviews.Content: In fact, this was my second stay. Last time I got my room upgraded to a suite, not so lucky this time but it was a busy weekend. Yes the rooms are small but nevertheless I find them comfy enough and with everything I need. I pay a little more to secure a higher floor. Staff are helpful and I really like the location - it's got a nice neighborhood feel, far enough away from the bar-madness of LKF to feel peaceful, but near enough to walk there if you want it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SEAsiafan
Reviews.Content: There were a few issues with this hotel that other people have touched on. The beds are undeniably small -- I'm short (155 cm), and the bed wasn't all that much longer than I am -- and the walls are thin enough to make the sound of peoples' showers in the neighboring rooms really annoying at night. I saw no sign of any "complimentary fruit." I suppose the rooms might seem small to some people, and they weren't huge, but I'm from Japan and the hotels there are not especially bigger -- and much more expensive. But the location was great! Only one subway stop from Central and other downtown areas, it was within walking distance of all the antique shops and galleries on Hollywood Road, and right in the middle of a residential area/typical Chinese shop area. Lots of local color, with shops selling dried fish products and birds' nests. Some fantastic local restaurants, including a great dim sum place, were within walking distance. Walking to Central was even manageable -- giving you the advantages of proximity to the heart of the city, yet the advantage of staying in a quieter place that felt like "home" after a few days. Local parks were fun to walk through in the morning. There were some little extras that helped balance out the annoying noise level -- three thick towels a person, nice bathrobes. The view was nice enough, if not spectacular. I'd probably stay there again -- the fun of the neighborhood made up for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location,Quirky hotel and interesting room layout”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller1991
Reviews.Content: At first inspection we were a little disappointed with the hotel, the rooms were small and en-suite behind a glass panel. However on investigating more of Hong Kong and learning about the way of life and lack of space people have it was very typical of the city. People live in very small apartments as space is at a premium and actually the rooms were a decent size considering. It was very clean and there was complimentary fresh fruit. The breakfast was sufficient, although was a little limited and after two nights is less interesting. The location was great, and walking distance to restaurants, zoological gardens and the longest outdoor escalator.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed and 20 mins walk into HK escalators”
Reviews.Author: PandoraSkies
Reviews.Content: An eclectic hidden gem of a hip hotel, deceptively roomy indoors and incredible value for money, hidden in an unassuming fringe of the financial and social scene of Hong Kong Central. Surprisingly stylish, an impressive chandaliered twisted staircase leads you to a shabby-chic styled lobby and mirrored elevators that feel more like a Parisienne boudoir than an oriental retreat. City-scape themes of London and New york continue the urban theme into each floor which have some 6-8 rooms each, all compact in size eve with upgrades, but cleverly designed to offer sleek and minimalist furnishings and frameless glass ensuites. For dining you do need to step outside, but 5 mins walk has you staight in the mix of the hectic Hong Kong social and shopping scene.

Reviews.Title: “Disheartening staff, a downer in upbeat HK”
Reviews.Author: march-hilton
Reviews.Content: Truly terribly trained staff - brusque, uninvolved, dismissive, uncaring. Does no-one care about the human-contact experience in this hotel? Certainly took any nice edge off the experience of this hotel on lovely Hollywood Road.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel for travelers!”
Reviews.Author: ninjagirl6
Reviews.Content: LOCATION : the location was really nice especially if you want to be in the middle of the HK neighborhood. near to the MTR station, convenient stores and fooderies. i recommend exporing around the Hollywood Road area if you stay here. also near a little Park i think it was the Hollywood Park? nice to visit for a morning walk. ROOM & HOTEL : at first my family was kind of surprised at how small it was cus the hotel building is tucked in the little neighborhood area but i was pleased to see it was placed in a great location for walking. don't be startled when you see the lobby the decor is rediculous but once you get to the rooms they're nice and clean although really small and cramped. but if you're planning on travelling all day long i don't think the small room is going to be a problem anyways. bathrooms are clean all though a bit weird since the shower and toilet are in separate compartments. rooms are regularly cleaned up which was nice. STAFF : english is layed with thick accents but you'll get used to it. the staff is okay. FOOD : the breakfast was okay but if you plan on starting your day with an early breakfast you won't be able to eat at the hotel cus the hotel's breakfast buffet opens later than usual like around 9 which seems usual fo HK standards since all the shops only get going around that time but unusual for hotel standards. overall i liked it and you get great value for your money. definitely recommended for the young traveler looking for a great bargain hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our time here”
Reviews.Author: Hanfluff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year. Firstly we booked a room for three nights while we tried to find permanent accomadation for our 6 month stay in the country. Room was well decorated, brilliant views. Very clean. Bathroom was lovely. We then booked a serviced apartment for 4 weeks on the first floor. Was much louder downstairs, woken up early each morning by the traffic. Breakfast was costly and only went once although the food was nice. The room was a studio, with seperate bathroom. Kitchenette contained a kettle and microwave and mini fridge. Wardrobe space wasn't adequate (but I admit I have alot of clothes). Bed was comfy, towels changed daily. Cleanliness was excellent thoughout whole hotel. Staff were pleasant, although still knocked on the door when "do not disturb" was displayed. Couldn't walk in the hotel without someone opening the door and greeting you. Overall liked this hotel, it carries nice memories for me.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: JayB2710
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels many time in HK but was searching for a well-priced and well-located hotel in Central...and I think I found my answer in this one...rooms are very small though...but hotel is tastefully decorated in a "boutiqish" manner....and Hollywood Road where it is located is an interesting locale..not too far from the business centre and within walkable distance of SoHo...overall a good proposition

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: theloneagent
Reviews.Content: I stay here many times per year on my frequent trips to HK. In a city that can be very expensive for nice accommodations the Central Park is a great value. Rooms always clean, good shower and a large be for HK standards. Location is great for Central in antique district but close to HK main nightlife center.

Reviews.Title: “Too many small annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Sandyarbuthnot
Reviews.Content: Although it's not awful, there are just too many small annoyances at this hotel. As mentioned by others, the Walls are very thin, beds are short and there are so many other small niggles: TV didn't always work, noisy showers, taps were wobbly, cupboard didn't close, staff's English was very hard to understand and they weren't really trained well in customer service, room smelled of smoke, dirty windows, broken lightbulb, wobbly shower fittings, one elevator being used as a service elevator, fire escape being used to store flammable bedding... None of it was really bad, but in this day and age not what many travellers want to put up with. It's not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy, small and inconvenient.”
Reviews.Author: jl05xi
Reviews.Content: Service was average, room was much smaller than average and the whole room just felt stuffy and icky after two days. The glass of the shower room was covered in left-over soap grime and you would think that the cleaning staff would at leaste try to cover something like that up. It was definitely not worth the price. The location is great if you're looking for precious Chinese antiques or if you want to get away from the big tourist areas, but other than that, there really isn't anything much around there. I stayed with my mother and she had mentioned that there is a crematory one or two buildings next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you're a midget who likes lifts”
Reviews.Author: KenPork
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Sept 2010. The rooms are tiny (althoug clean). The rooms reminded me of living in student accommodation. I am 6ft tall and the beds were too short. They are not fit for Westerners unless you are a PORG (person of restricted growth). A colleague who stayed there had the business breakfast and got food poisoning. As there are only 2 and the staff kept using one as a service lift which meant we had to wait ages for the other lift to come. When it did arrive people were squeezed in like sardines. When we checked out the stairs (also doubling as a fire escape) we found boxes of toilet rolls, mattresses and cupboards blocking exits and the stairs themselves. They use the stairs as storage. I was meant to stay there for 2 weeks and I checked out after the first week to move to another hotel. It was unsafe and cramped. The Lan Kwai Fong is much superior.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, there are better hotels in the area.”
Reviews.Author: Asperger_Singapore
Reviews.Content: 1. Location: At one end of the very interesting Hollywood Road, Hong Kong Island. Horrendous as it is a good walk away (15 mins, fast walking) from the nearest MTR station, on a steep uphill incline. Not fun especially after a hard day's worth of shopping and loaded with bags. Good number of eateries and convenience stores around. 2. Staff: Courteous, helpful. When they are not busy (which is rare, cos hotel seems to be pretty popular), they do take extra effort to address guests' needs . . . this is great! 3. Rooms: Ridiculously small, even by HK standards. Two guests with two big luggages will effectively mean no more room to walk in the room without hitting bags and / or furniture. The worst thing about the room is the BED: it is very low and ridiculously soft. Good for some, I guess, but I really hated it; 4 nights without sleeping terribly well on it. 4. Facilities: Free internet service and computers on the Mezzanine floor. Can't comment on breakfast as I did not eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel, very convenient Central location.”
Reviews.Author: JSMBali
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money and extremely convenient to Central. Queens Road Central is just a few minutes walk away. The nightlife in Lan Kwai Fong and SOHO only 10 minutes walk away. Rooms are small but clean. Staff are efficient and friendly. If you're looking for a nice, clean boutique hotel that is good value for money and close to lots of action then this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great price in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: bklynbubba
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit here and I'm reluctant to write this review only because I feel like I am letting the cat out of the bag. This hotel is really lovely, top notch staff who make you feel welcome and are there to take care of you. The location is perfect on Hollywood Road, just a few blocks down from Soho. While the rooms are on the small side they offer spectacular views and are quite comfortable. Breakfast buffet is fine, but additional and not included in the room rate. Late check out was not a problem. Whatever your question about Hong Kong, they will answer it for you. Restaurant reservations, tours, airport transportation, whatever you need to know, the friendly staff here will take care of you. I hope to visit again and again. As much as I want the place to remain my secret, stay here, you won't regret it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: meteorstar
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service! We checked in quite late and were given the keys quite fast (less than 5minutes!). The staffs are friendly to provide all information with a local map and at the counter. Definitely must praise their professional service and attitude. They even knock on the door at to check if we needed a room service. The environment is cosy, though the lobby is quite small. Ahh yes, It's the first time i have seen green apples served free outside every lift of each floor. Sweet! Although the room is very small, it is very well designed with everything needed for a a few nights stay. Airport drop off service is available every 30minutes ! How convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Should be given them as "Best Service" award!”
Reviews.Author: Lucianian
Reviews.Content: I was totally disappointed by the recieptionist plus the reservation guy by the name Keith. Perhaps, I did told them I have some problems with my card & would like to pay in cash personally before the day of checking in. Just to secure a room for myself. But in the end, I called to tell them I'm interested to stay and paid cash. One of the staff members said to me that we are very BUSY today, and can't be attended to you. Plus I call up the reservation dept and they told me come & paid in cash. Ended up, it was disappointing that I did not even get a room on that day, plus they are giggling on the phone in Cantonese while I have trouble looking for a hotel. Therefore, PLEASE DO NOT EVEN THINK OF THIS HOTEL. nevertheless, they are not even train to speak proper ENGLISH! mh gosh, CALL themselves a FOUR STARs HOTEL. They are worst than those hostel I know. Guys, if u have booked it. I would say sorry, is the worst hotel in hong kong ever!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay at this hotel, tired very small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: fred1099
Reviews.Content: This is a sad budget hotel trying to make out it is of international standard. First room we were shown was microscopic and stank. The second room (Garden view) was larger but no door between the washbasin and beds which are too short for the average European. The toilet had an unacceptable smell. The safe did not work and was bolted to a removable shelf in the wardrobe. Breakfast was a joke, the hot food was inedible and selection of all foods cereals etc. very limited. Charge for internet HK$130/24hrs is ridiculous, walked short distance up road and used free internet at Pacific Coffee shop. Very noisy, when the next room had a shower we had to turn the TV up. The staff tried their best but the irredeemable state of the rooms and facilities made their efforts futile.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money; good location; room small but normal for HK”
Reviews.Author: travelerdavel
Reviews.Content: I have noticed numerous complaints about this hotel's room size. Granted they are small. If you have stayed at other hotels in HK you would find the same situation - unless you want to double your cost or triple your cost. Hotel is a nice location on Hollywood Road. Ten minute plelasant walk to the escalators and Soho's numerous restaurnats, bars and hundreds of antique shops. Taxis are easy to find; close to the Ariport Express Terminal and ferry terminals. Walking around the area is a pleasant adventure. Market streets that are just below Soho are great to walk through. Hundreds of photo ops. Just be prepared for small rooms. But location and cost were fine. I had no problems with noise and slept well for three nights. Have also stayed in their sister hotel Lan Kway Feng Hotel - about 6 blocks away. About the same but pricier - nice rooms, but again, small. Staff behind the desk were not warm and cuddly, but doorman was very helpful and pleasant. They have internet, but I did not use it. Can go to a wifi hot spot - I just used my iPhone for email and surfing. Re comment below - nearly every hotel at which I have stayed in Asia make you wait a minute while they check your minibar. Standard procedure. Just check-out or tell them you are checking out three minutes early to give housekeeping a chance to check. Not a problem if you are prepared. Just suck it up and roll with it. Ha.

Reviews.Title: “very poor value for money, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Callanish
Reviews.Content: I'm just back from a couple of nights' stay in this hotel. I would not recommend it to others. The good points first: my room was spotlessly clean, the location is only a short cab ride from Central station, and there are excellent and affordable local restaurants within a few minutes walk of the front door. Unfortunately all these were spoilt by the small room size, the lack of sound-proofing from adjacent rooms (think of the scene in the Sex and the City 2 movie where there's a crying baby on one side, and a very happy couple on the other), and poor customer service - I don't think I've ever encountered such rude and unhelpful reception desk staff. I booked the room through a travel company so did not expect a receipt from the hotel, but requested a copy of registration/confirmation that I had stayed at the hotel for refund purposes, but was refused this. On checking out they asked me to wait until they checked that I had not stolen anything from the room. I travel a lot with business (as well as on personal trips) so I'm used to a variety of approaches to customer care, but never staff as blunt and dismissive of a paying customer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small rooms but value for money”
Reviews.Author: mndrdg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Central Park Hotel on a friend's recommendation and because the location was close by a local friend's apartment. It was also a reasonable price for HK. Overall, not disappointed - my expectations were pretty low but it really is quite OK. Not 4 star but 3 star. Rooms are compact and the bathroom is basically a shower and a toilet, with a washbasin in the room as well. Bed was very comfortable (with a nice doona) and air-conditioning worked well. Staff at reception were very helpful and easy to deal with, especially given how busy they were when we checked in. We left some luggage at the hotel when we went off to Macau for a night - and that wasn't a problem at all. Didn't bother with the in-house breakfast so can't comment on that - we ate brekky locally and had coffees and free internet access at a nearby Pacific Coffee shop (there are loads of these around). Hotel is in a good area, just outside of the Central district, and about 5-10 minutes walk to the MTR and to trams. Taxis were easy to get and walking along Hollywood Road past cafes, bars, galleries etc was fun. The long escalators are about 10 minutes walk away too. Only problem we had was in the room given to us on our second visit - we were given room 807 which has a small window, with no view, and was not a nice room at all. We asked for a new room and were given a better room on a higher floor with a great view and big windows. So don't accept a room number ending in 7 - we had 1903 and 1601 which were fine, both with lots of light and big windows to make the room seem smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location - Definitely recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Justind97
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and very nice. Upon entry into the lobby you are greeted by the concierge at the front desk. They do speak English, a little bit broken, but very helpful nonetheless. The rooms are a bit small in comparison to North American standards but still very nice. The bathrooms will be a bit odd for Westerners since the walls are opaque and do not provide much privacy. The beds are comfortable, and they do provide internet access, 3HKD per minute to a maximum of 120HKD per day, or 500HKD for 7 days I believe. The hotel is in a great location. Located about an 8 minute walk from the closest Starbucks, there are tons of places to eat in the area. The hotel is also located about the same distance from the district known as Soho. North of Hollywood Rd in Soho you will find the Westerners District full of restaurants from pubs to Chinese food places as well. The hotel is not far from several subway stops, the botanical gardens and about a 25 minute walk from the ferry port.

Reviews.Title: “"Boutique" hotel is a relative term...don't trust the website!”
Reviews.Author: SwitzerNYC
Reviews.Content: Tiny, tiny rooms. I reserved a room with two twin beds and a view of the park which cost slightly more. When we checked in the desk clerk said he had "upgraded" us. HAH! The first room was on the street on the second floor with a queen size bed. It was depressingly small. The second room they took us to was not much better and still facing the street. We finally agreed to having two rooms and they moved us to the 21st floor with a park view, but only after having a melt down. They kept saying "we are a boutique hotel". Location is pretty good, but don't plan to share a room unless you REALLY enjoy the other persons company. When the next door neighbor took a shower I couldn't hear the TV. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room”
Reviews.Author: awful_in_aqua86
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the CPH in July 2009 for one night with my boyfriend and was pretty disappointed with how tiny the room was for the amount we paid. The walls were very thin and the bed was like a mattress on the floor. Was clean enough and in a good location, but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small rooms and there is no soundproofing whatsoever!”
Reviews.Author: TesGlasgow
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. The rooms are too small. Furnishing are "tired". The soundproofing was awful. Not only could we hear the gentleman in the next room talking on his mobile during the night but also the person on the other end!!!! I would go so far as to say this hotel actually spoiled my trip to Hong Kong! When we left in the mornings we stayed away until it was time to go to bed! Not that we managed to sleep due the noise of other residents just going about their business!

Reviews.Title: “the hotel Room is really small,internet charge is way too much.”
Reviews.Author: Sherryat
Reviews.Content: I have been to HK seveal times and try different hotels with different price range. The room is really small compare with other same price range hotel. when I open the door, I cannot even roll in my luggage. the location is around the chinese medicine stores. There are two supermarket near by. Theri chinese hotel name is misleading people, the hotel is located at Sheung Wan and need to walk 5 to 10 mins to the station. the lobby design of hotel is really unfriendly for luggage carrier.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service, bad layout of rooms”
Reviews.Author: Carollovestravel
Reviews.Content: 1 booked 3 rooms for myself and my family for 2 nights, we arrived to check in early approx 11 am due to our flight arrival. We were kindly shown to a meeting room and given complimentary drinks while they made up one of our rooms to enable us to freshen up and leave our luggage before our sight seeing. The reception and lobby area was small but very well presented with holograms of fish and birds on the wall. The rooms were very clean with lots of complimentary items, plus extras like sewing kit and adapters to use. I thought the room was small but for a 2 night stay not a problem. I didn't like the sink in the bedroom area, or the shower/toilet cubicle which we found at the slightest touch the opaque glass rattled! We had no problem with noise at the hotel and found the beds very comfortable. The location was good to get to all points of interest, no comment on breakfast as we decided to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Am excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: gilds282
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The staff are super friendly, the rooms very clean and full of amenities (from a kettle and free tea/coffee to bath robes). The rooms are not huge but are cleverly designed to make them feel spacious. The location is also excellent with great restaurants, bars, street food and shops within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge a book by its cover!”
Reviews.Author: ZoeGreg
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on hotels.com for a great price so gave it a go. It looked great from the outside & is located on Hollywood Road nearish the Sheung Wan stop of the MTR. Inside the hotel lobby was very cramped & the staff were also quite 'off'. We have been to Hong Kong before & have always been impressed by how polite & friendly hotel staff are, so the lack of this at Central Park hotel was a bit of a shock. We were upgraded to a suite which was a nice surprise. The interior of the hotel had been decorated to a high standard & looked very stylish, our room looked very nice & we thought what a good choice we had made... Bad points: The bed was too short! I'm 5'6" & the bed was just about long enough for me, my partner found his feet hanging off the end. Not what you expect in a hotel posing itself as being high quality. The bathroom was very cramped & the sink was in the bedroom area, again not what you would expect from a hotel like this. The room was incredibly noisy. I'm not sure if it was the lift or something else, but all through the night there was a terrible noise & we both hardly got any sleep as a result & were glad to have been only staying there one night! In general we felt that the suite could have been laid out better, the bedroom was very cramped in order to provide a second dining/sitting area - probably would have been better as an open plan layout. The location is ok, the walk to the MTR isn't that bad but we found for getting around HK it was a bit of a pain having to keep changing lines as Sheung Wan is the last stop on the blue 'Island line'. This hotel has so much potential as the decor really does look great, it just feels like they weren't thinking when the room layout was decided upon - the length of the beds is quite shocking!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, modest but modern interior... (accidental bugs in the room!)”
Reviews.Author: koxen
Reviews.Content: HOTEL: I liked the style: modern, quiet and clean. The traditional Chinese garden near the hotel is really charming! Location is very convenient - just a few steps from Midlevels, Macau Ferry, taxi always easy to catch. ROOMS&SERVICE: Tiny rooms are ok if you need hotel only for a sleep at night. There were fruits in our rooms on the day of arrival. But BE AWARE: there were bed-bugs in my parents room!! Yes. Waken up deep at night, because bugs started biting them! Many of them in the bed..... No insects in my room next door, however. Of course, we were immediately moved (3 at night) to other floor and were not bothered by any insects next several nights of our stay, however, you understand... the impression was ruined.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel well worth concidering”
Reviews.Author: explorerEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on H.K Island ,In the older ,very interesting area called the mid-levels.It is 7 mins walk away from Sheung tube Station. We got a very good price for bed only.,But the breakfasts were disappointing.The staff were very helpful and curteous.We stayed in 2 different rooms during our 10 day stay both were well equipped modern bright and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, interesting location”
Reviews.Author: PacificBlue
Reviews.Content: The Central Park Hotel offers great value in an interesting location. Staff were helpful and friendly; the room clean and pleasant, though on the small side for a westerner used to bigger spaces. The location is a plus: the hotel is situated at one end of Hollywood Road (aka Antiques Street) with its myriad of antique shops, modern art galleries, cafes, bars and restaurants. It's a pleasant walk to the main thoroughfares in Central, and close-ish to trendy Lan Kwai Fong. On the other side of the hotel is a charming traditional Chinese garden, complete with ornamental carp ponds, little pavillions, old ladies doing exercises and old men playing draughts - a nice place for an after-dinner stroll. Nearby too are colourful places like Dried Seafood Street, with its desiccated sea slugs and dried sharks' fins etc (I know - I winced too). Ask for a room overlooking the garden, or spend a bit more and get a bigger executive room up high for views of skyscrapers etc.

Reviews.Title: “The best Boutique Hotel in Hong Kong.”
Reviews.Author: RNY11
Reviews.Content: Until I found this hidden jewel of a Hotel, I thought Boutique Hotels did not exist in HK. Don't get me wrong HK has some of the best Hotel's in the world, and the price reflects that. While Central Park is a true value for the money. Friendly staff, recently renovated lobby and rooms as well as a great lounge. I am looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staffs”
Reviews.Author: knockitdown
Reviews.Content: We checked in very late at night due to some delays in our flight. Staffs at the reception were friendly and brought us right to our room. At first glance, the room is neat and tidy. But we found that the beds were abnormally low; bathroom was unusually large too. The wall-mount LCD TV was painfully small! Worst of all, THERE WERE NO WINDOWS!!! It wasn’t until later then we realized it’s a handicap-friendly room. We immediately asked for a change, but were told all other rooms are full, and they can only change it for us the following morning. Sure enough, we were transferred to another room the next morning, it was smaller but with a satisfactory garden view. The beds were so comfortable that I didn’t want to get up; we ended up spending most of the time watching Beijing Olympics on TV. Breakfast was not included, but it’s perfectly fine since there are local coffee shops nearby serving some of the best breakfast I ever had at very affordable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: kmgk
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in the Sheung Wan area close to Central. Hotel is extremely clean! Rooms are small, but beautiful. Staff are friendly as well. Breakfast was excellent! Would definitely go back to the Central Park Hotel Hongkong.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mixu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for two nights and booked an executive city room at HKD 990 / per night (taxes included). We got a room on 20th floor and a stunning view to the skyscrapers of Hongkong – not quite the calibre of IFC or Bank of China, but buildings tall enough to impress us and give the genuine HK feel to our stay. The front office staff was very friendly, efficient and polite. They remembered to greet us every time we passed the reception. The housekeeping also is up to the same standard, and we got the requested iron together with ironing board in minutes. The room was not a large one and there was not really a convenient place to put your luggage. We kept it on the floor and sometimes stumbled on the way to the bathroom. The bed also was quite short and I found my feet hanging outside the bed (I’m 192 cm tall, so this might not be a problem for all). The décor of the room was quite modern and contemporary, just the cupboards were a bit strange and probably legacy fixture. I would simply remove them as you really don’t need something reminding of a kitchen cabinet in your hotel room. Breakfast was not included in our room rate, but they are many nice places just next to the hotel. For example, Graze on 143-145 Bonham Strand serves delicious breakfast. The room we had was a very quiet one. We felt like being the only guests in the whole floor. We did not hear a cheep outside our room during our stay. The location of the hotel is an excellent one: we did not even use the MTR during our stay as you could easily walk to Central and Lan Kwai Fong. I think the hotel offered very good value for the money, and despite the hanging feet, I definitely would stay again. The only thing I really disliked was the lack of free internet. I think it starts to be quite customary to offer free access and charging for it is a bit greedy.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you Need to Know about Central Park Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: HeartTravelLondon
Reviews.Content: Certainly not luxury, but great basic hotel if you prefer to save your money for shopping, massages and eating/drinking like we did! Pros: - great location! easy walking distance to tons of bars and restaurants (go left from hotel down Hollywood Rd), also easy walking distance to ferries (for Macau, other islands etc.) - basic, clean accomodation - good water pressure, hot water - great curtains keep out the light in the morning - comfortable beds Cons: - noise in the mornings: not from outside, mainly from the shower in other rooms - bathroom: sink area is in room as opposed to behind closed doors; toilet/shower area are behind glass wall/door - you can't see more than general outline of people - but not ideal if you're shy - size: the rooms are pretty small (as is standard in most cities), but two girls with lots of stuff managed to find creative storage solutions and were fine

Reviews.Title: “Small room but Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Nightclub
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to stay in this hotel. Room is kind of small but fine for one person like me. The staff had made up the small room issue. Reception staff always smile and friendly. Bellboy very helpful and they can tell you a good place to eat or to go. Love the location, 5 to 7 minute to subway station or tram station (cable car). It also a reasonable price hotel, I sure will stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “hmmm..”
Reviews.Author: lardner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice ..and yes, the rooms are tiny and the bathroom is IN the room but it is a great location. However, the second time I satyed, I was obviously in a smoking room and it made my eyes water - even the bedding smelt of cigarettes..not pleasant! So, all in all, I will be looking for a new cheap hotel next time I come!

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: BobBon1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has several things going for it; cental location, well appointed rooms and reasonable rates. However, it has one major disadvantage - the attitude of its staff!!! We were awoken at 3am (on a Monday morning) by the guests of the suite next to our room. Upon returning home from a boozy night, they had basically decided to have an impromptu party and were making such a racket that several people on our floor got up to see what the noise was. It carried on for 15 minutes before I knocked politely and asked them to be a bit quieter. They were incredibly rude, aggressive and obviously drunk (and by the looks of it, high.) At 3.30am I decided to call reception and ask them to intervene. The manager came up to our floor and made a half arsed attempt to ask them to be quiet but to be honest, it was just lip service to our complaint. At 4.15am, with the noise from next door intensifying, I rang reception again and demanded to be moved. At 5am, I finally got to bed (in another room, on another floor, with all my belongings in the room 5 floors down)!! The next morning, I spoke to reception about the problem and they were again, unsympathetic and pretty rude. Basically, they would not be moving the noisy guests or asking them to be quiet because they were paying a (slightly) higher room rate so if they wanted to make noise, then they could!! If we had a problem, we could pack up all our stuff and move rooms. Needless to say - I was less than impressed with them!! On my return to the hotel that evening, I was told by the manager that they had actually spoken to the guests concerned and that there would be no repeat of what happend the night before. I suggested I moved any way but it was greated with an attitude of 'whatever'!! Surprise surprise, at 4.30am this morning, I was awoken by the same guests who were now entertaining their own 'guests' - singing at the top of their voices and jumping around. I ring reception and demand to be moved - only to be told that they will see what they can do!! Whilst I wait for 45 minutes to be moved, 3 members of the hotel staff deliver beer and snacks to the room next door. It is only when I call back again (and by this time, I'm livid!!) and demand to be moved that it happens. For a second night in a row, I end up sleeping in another room, with none of my own stuff and then having to walk back to my own room in the morning just so that I can have a wash. Oh, and I had to pay full price for the 2 nights of lost sleep - only adds insult to injury!! So in summary, DON"T STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!! There are better, cheaper and nicer places to stay. In addition, our room had red ants constantly crawling along the surfaces (and we were on the 20th floor!) and there is no regulation of the water temperature - no hot water whatsoever in the basin and boiling hot or freezing cold in the shower. They are also 'renovating' floors 1-10 so you are basically living on a building sight, sharing the lifts etc with the builders and constantly building paint fumes!

Reviews.Title: “Decent value”
Reviews.Author: jkofman
Reviews.Content: I found everything about this hotel to be average if not below par. Understanding that this is Hong Kong, the room is of average size, the amenities (soap, shampoo, etc) are average, the location is average (about 7 min walk to the MTR), the desk staff sometimes were surly and other times helpful. While nothing was especially good about the hotel I was disappointed by the lack of water temperature control (either scalding hot or tepid) and the lack of light in my room. While this was great for sleeping (and the bed was fairly comfortable) it made working difficult. Not likely to stay here again even though it was somewhat inexpensive. Their other property, Lan Kwai Fok Hotel, is better value even though more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “not bad!!”
Reviews.Author: BISCUITWANG
Reviews.Content: i was there for a business trip. the room is tindy but enough for a single travel . or someone who is not too picky for the size. great for younfg business trip. you can feel it was just refunsihed from very old building though.. overall ... it 's a clean , nice , small , design hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: JGD_Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a couple of times last month and thought the place was great. Rooms were fairly small but well designed, and both had a nice view. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location in SheungWan is fantastic - close to the MTR, Macau ferry pier, mid-level escalator etc... and with a great variety of little shops nearby (particularly antique shops on Hollywood Road, but also everything from shops specializing in bird's nests through to the ubiquitous 7/11). Central is also only a $15 (~£1) cab ride away... I paid about £55 a night, and at this price I thought this hotel was fantastic value. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “25th anniversary celebration”
Reviews.Author: Terrago
Reviews.Content: We have just recently returned from 6 nights at the Central Park Hotel...we had a great time even though the airport had been closed for 10 hours just prior to our arrival due to torrential rain and flooding. The service was excellent all through the stay and the room was well presented, clean with plenty of toiletries and a clean shower/toilet. The location was ideal near the older part of the city near most of the antique shops and about 10 minutes walk from the main street...another 10 minutes to the harbour. It wasn't an expensive holiday and we won't forget our 25th wedding anniversary celebration

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Caer_83
Reviews.Content: I really don't know what people are complaining about this hotel for. Fine, it's not the Ritz but... you're not paying for the Ritz. Rooms were plenty big enough and served the purpose. Staff friendly and helpfull calling our airport transfer company for us when they were late etc. Even the toilet in the same room is an really not as bad as it sounds. The set up is the same as anyother hotel with en suite simply with opaque glass as opposed to a wooden door.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maryana
Reviews.Content: I know, that Hong Kong has small hotel rooms, but our newly renovated garden view double room at Central Park Hotel was the tiniest I have ever stayed at. It was literary no space to put the luggage. If you need to use a lap top in the room, you will have to search for space on the deck really hard. Deck at the same time is a counter for the sink. Shower is good, but be careful adjusting the water, for me it was either too cold, or too hot. I would not say, that there is no privacy in the bathroom, the glass walls are matte and you can not see through it. The bed is low, but comfortable, which is a great find for any Asian hotels. Nice touch was a fruit basket in the room. Hotel, room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Hotel is not that close to the MTR station, I would say 10 min walk at least. There is another cheaper accommodation alternative right in front of MTR exit. There is no problem catching a cab there. I liked the location of Central Park Hotel because I used to walk everywhere in the Island, you may stroll on Hollywood road all the way trough to mid level escalators, Lan Kwan Fong, Central and beyond. Close to the hotel is great French restaurant on Hollywood road.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Clychan
Reviews.Content: Apart from the convenient location of the hotel (about 10-15 minutes walk to the nightlife, bars and restaurants of SoHo and Lan Kwai Fong and its proximity to the MTR, bus stops and tram stops) and being in a part of Hong Kong which has a very 'old Hong Kong' feel about it with all the ginseng and Chinese herb shops, there is nothing good about this hotel. If you like a clean and comfortable hotel room then forget it. (1) There was mould growing on one wall of the room I was allocated and the shower and toilet were worn, (2) the shower only provided freezing cold water or scaldingly hot water throughout my stay (despite being 'fixed' three times), (3) the only thing dividing the shower and toilet from the bed was a glass partition and (4) the cleaners were tardy - a 'new' bathrobe was left on my bed after a daily room clean one day but it had a huge caked-up stain on it. If you're after a budget hotel and looking to do all the touristy things, try something in Causeway Bay which is a much busier area and is still very central and a short ride on the MTR to most things.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but shower is not for shy people”
Reviews.Author: stevew918
Reviews.Content: The hotel is better than I thought! It is very difficult to find a hotel room in Hong Kong during the Chinese New Year! After reading all the previous reviews, I had concerns. But this is the only hotel with room available and at a rate I could afford. so here I am. Staff: Actually the hotel staff attitude was pretty good. Check in was easy, fast and with a smile. At 4 a.m. in the middle of the night, I wanted to log on internet, and could not find an internet connection. So I called the receptionlist. They sent someone within one minute, with a cable in hand, and actually connected my computer to the internet. To me, that is great service! Room size: The room size is actually above average for Hong Kong. I would say it is even slightly bigger than some others I have stayed in Hong Kong. The table along the window wall was very space-saving and functional. Bed: The bed is firm, but quite comfortable. My mom and I slept like a log. When I mentioned my concern when I checked in, the receptionist said they can bring a soft bed-pad is needed. If you prefer very soft bed, this is something to consider. Shower: I definitely will need sometime to get used to this. As you can see from the pictures, the shower is at corner of the room, and there is no way to get undressed in privacy. As I am staying with my mom this time. I need to think of something. At my age, I am not ready to be seen naked by my mom. So I am taking a shower when my mom is asleep. The hotel should at least add a curtain of something. If you intend to share a room in this hotel, make sure you are comfortable being seen naked by your room-mates or be prepared to shower in the middle of the night. Heat: Please note that there is no heat in the room, as in many HK hotels. In the winder, this can be an issue with some people who comes from warm countries. I put on the provided shower robe, and it worked just fine to keep me warm. Other than the shower, this is an acceptable HK hotel to me. Location is great, room size if ok, and staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Antiques”
Reviews.Author: spyke5
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right at the end of all the antique shopping on Hollywood Rd. The room we had was very small but the staff was nice and most things were easy walking distance. Not close so when i say walking i mean 15 to 30 min walk. I would pick this place again if the price is still right.

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared”
Reviews.Author: Leo200748
Reviews.Content: Having looked online for accommodation at a reasonable price, Hong Kong was pretty expensive, so I decided on the 3 star property which is Central Park. It was 130Euros a night, so we expected reasonable, comfortable but not luxurious accommodation. Nothing really prepared us for this hotel. Firstly the staff are nice, and really friendly as are all Chinese. However, the hotel room is TINY. No space if you have a standard sized suitcase and/or large backpacks. The bed, shower and toilet (not nice) are in the same room, just cornered off by glass partitions. The toilet is just the toilet nothing else, the shower, just a showerhead, nothing else. When I say space is limited, it's almost like the pay-by-the hour hotels in Japan. The bed is hard, not memory matress hard, but kitchen counter top hard, no joke, it's ridiculous. We were on route from Sydney back to Ireland, and arrived to this property after a 9 hour flight at like 5pm in the evening, we were only staying 2 nights, just to literally see Hong Kong and so felt there was no point moving, had it been more than 2 nights we would definately have left. The hotel floor 17 which we were on stank of rotten herbs and disenfectant. It was not pleasant. There is a plasma TV in the room, but that's where the comforts end. I mean, it's not like it was budget accommodation, it wasn't cheap considering we had paid 80euros per night in 5 star luxury accommodation in New Zealand. The area, Hollywood Road is perfect if you want to experience the real Hong Kong, as it's all locals, no tourist, and no frills. It's humid, dirty, smelly but hey, it's real and the people are lovely and the experience good, but if you're coming for high life Hong Kong for Louis Vuitton shopping and expensive meals, then dont' stay here, it's not the right part of the city. We however weren't looking for top end, but comfort would have been nice. On the plus side it's only a 5min cab ride from Lan Kwai Fong (the main party district) and even though I was with my boyfriend, we checked out the red light bars in Wan Chai, as it was an experience and the nightclubs hilarious. The taxis are really cheap so a 30min cab ride to Stanley (a gorgeous ex pat filled village with a great chinese market) the taxi was 11euro! Hong Kong is an experience, and I'm glad we stayed at the Central Park becasue we got to see both sides of Hong Kong for a more wholesome experience. But if you stay here, all you are getting is a bed, and a very hard one at that.

Reviews.Title: “They will defraud you if you are vulnerable”
Reviews.Author: steviegeee
Reviews.Content: I'll try and keep this short. I checked into this hotel after a hospital visit for major eye surgery and stayed for 2 weeks, I just needed a place to recover. I contacted them before checking in and they quoted me a good rate. At checkout time I looked at the bill and found they had not stuck to the original agreement and had overcharged me by quite a large amount. Despite repeated attempts at finding a common ground they refused to budge. AVOID!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “cocky receptionist,poor english speaking staff”
Reviews.Author: tease_7
Reviews.Content: pros: clean room, lcd tv cons: rude staff especially the receptionists, hard to understand them, shower was separated from toilet but it only had 1 door!!!!! that was so weird!, the door was also a frosted one so you can still see thru the shower and toilet, also you can hear the ones staying next door

Reviews.Title: “It was better than i expected, small but cozy and clean”
Reviews.Author: mesexyqueen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Central Park Hotel for 3 nights. It's small, but i have read the reviews about it, so i wasn't really expecting a big place. It's clean, and ac was good and strong. I like how the color make the room look very cozy. The shower was kind of weird. when one is showering the other can see thru the transparents glass, so don't stay at this hotel if two of you are not comfortable watching the other person shower(or maybe if one shower the other has to leave the room) anyway, i had a pleasent stay. I definitily will go back there. It's a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Not very good but okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nasmeg
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 22 Oct 06 - 27 Oct 06. The room is small but clean. Confirmed the bed is hard as what others have been telling. Never never agree to stay on level 1 (room number 1XX), ask for room at least at level 2 and above. Rooms on level 1 really really [--], dirty, smelly and kind of different standards compared to rooms on the other levels. Most of the rooms smelled tobacco. The staff is not very friendly. The location is quite far from shopping centres and malls, but there are many eateries near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget find”
Reviews.Author: MissRyan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Central Park Hotel for 5 nights in Sept 06. I found the staff to be friendly and helpful, and the hotel to be nicely furnished and clean. It is well located, within easy walking distance of Hong Kong Central, shops, restaurants etc. Having read other reviews on here I was slightly worried about my choice, but it turned out to be fine. The room was an ok size, but I did have an 'executive' room, so god knows how small the standard ones are! I had no problems at all with hard beds or lack of hot water as mentioned by other people. I would suggest steering clear of the cafe next door though, I went in for a drink one night and saw a *huge* rat running around. Urgh.

Reviews.Title: “Central Park Hotel - a unique experience”
Reviews.Author: bobnick1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in March, 2006 for 8 nights. Let me first touch upon the negative - The bed was very hard, making it difficult to get proper sleep. The hot water didn't work consistently in the shower resulting in a few cold showers even after our comments to the staff. The room was small, 240 sq.feet, in fact the shower cube was in the sleeping area. Many rooms at this hotel are under 200 sq. feet. Some on line sites list a restaurant at this hotel, there is none. Now that is out of the way so let me say that we actually liked our stay at this hotel. The staff, despite some communication difficulties, was very friendly and couldn't give us enough service. The room was small but very high tech and space efficient with a 21 inch LCD TV, remote control AC unit, etc. and very clean. Our room overlooked Hollywood Park and had nice views looking west. The cost of the room was only $83US before taxes. It's best to book through an on line consolidator as it was much cheaper than directly through the hotel. The best thing upon our stay was the location. This hotel was away from the tourist areas of Hong Kong Island. In fact, there were no other hotels nearby. Despite its remoteness, everything was easily accessible. Many interesting sites such as the Man Mo Temple were only a few minutes walk away. The tram at Western Market was only a 5+ minute walk and the subway (MTR) at Sheung Wan another minute further. This location was very much inhabited by locals and not the well to do locals either. It was quite a site to see the many open markets in the area and small Chinese restaurants. We made daily purchases at the markets. No one spoke English but we all got our points across. Shopkeepers started to recognize us after a while and would wave as we passed by. Nearby was Herbal Medicine Street, Dried Seafood Street, and Bird's Nest and Ginseng Steet. The many high rise apartments in the area had laundry hanging all the way to 40 floors up. The neighborhood streets were twisting and climbing with many signs hanging over and across them. The rain and lack of sun for the first 5 days of our stay gave the place a surreal feel. Kind of like the set of the old "Blade Runner" film. We visited Macau, mainland China, and tramped all over Hong Kong but this location made our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great but bad serive”
Reviews.Author: coolboy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the central park hotel in Nov past and was impressed with the location the look of the hotel etc but the BEDS - rock hard don't do if you like soft beds we contacted the manager not luck , luckly my brother speak perfect chinese and was able to move our rooms to a better bed , you got the feeling they smile and said yes but did not really care much , apart from that nice looking hotel , nice facilities -Good value for money product but don't except the personal touch

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Jacksf
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel and thought it was fine. The location is at the end of Hollywood Rd, so it is about a 10 minute walk to Soho and the antique shops, and about 15 minutes to Lan Kwai Fong. Right next door is a small quiet park. The hotel and room had a nice, contemporary decor. The bed was a little hard, but the room size was fine. Overall, I thought it was a very good deal for the money. The location is off the beaten path, but only slightly so. I would consider staying again if I wanted to be on the HK side of Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: Wasabi312
Reviews.Content: For HK and the location, the hotel is a pretty good deal. I was looking for a cheap (but decent) hotel for a night and this fit the bill - A short walk to all the resturants in Soho, clean rooms, right price. The room are tiny - even for HK standards; I felt like I was taking a shower next to my bed. The bed is also the hardest bed that I have ever slept on. They try to do the most with decor in the room - minimalist design, flat screen TV, etc so it's not bad for short stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Central Park Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.263 Hollywood Road, Zhongxi District, Hong Kong, China
